<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/27/extra-unemployment-benefits-drying?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Extra Unemployment Benefits Are Drying Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An employer holds flyers for hospitality employment during a Zislis Grou..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTcxL3VzLXVuZW1wbG95bWVudC1qb2IuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Patrick T. Fallon/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ten more states including Florida, Ohio, and Texas <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/enhanced-unemployment-benefits-end-june-26-10-states/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ended extra unemployment benefits</a> on Saturday. They join 12 other states that have already opted out this month; all together, 26 states have said “thanks but no thanks” to assistance that’s available until September. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Their reasoning: Get rid of those Help Wanted signs. Businesses are desperate to hire workers, and many states think scrapping the extra $300/week in unemployment benefits, which the Biden administration incorporated into its pandemic relief bill, will spur more job-seeking. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is it working?  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Could be. In 22 states that canceled enhanced benefits this month, the number of people receiving unemployment benefits is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/americans-are-leaving-unemployment-rolls-more-quickly-in-states-cutting-off-benefits-11624786202?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">falling faster</a> than in states that have extended the program longer, according to an analysis by Jefferies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the states that cut off the extra payments the earliest, the number of workers who were paid benefits decreased 13.8% from mid-May to mid-June.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That number fell 10% in states cutting benefits in July and 5.7% in states that are waiting it out until September. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other data paints a cloudier picture, though. Earlier this month, the job site Indeed found that job search activity fell <a href="https://twitter.com/JedKolko/status/1402665246456651777?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>below</em> the national trend</a> in states that cut off extra benefits in June.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Extra unemployment benefits are dividing people more than pineapple on pizza. Industry groups and Republican lawmakers say that the extra payments disincentivize work and are the leading cause of the worker shortage. 25 out of the 26 states that axed the benefits early are led by GOP governors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some economists and Democrats have said that other factors, such as greater childcare burdens or the fear of contracting Covid, are to blame. On Capitol Hill last week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that extra benefits <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/fed-chair-powell-be-grilled-again-inflation-interest-rates-unemployment-n1271921?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could be playing a role</a> in the worker shortage problem, but focused his attention on other challenges holding back the job market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>four more states end enhanced benefits on July 10. Perhaps by then we’ll have more data to understand how the extra $300/week has played a role in the labor market’s sluggish recovery.</p>

<img alt="Cranes are seen at a partially collapsed building in Surfside, Florida, ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTcyL3VzLWFjY2lkZW50LWNvbnN0cnVjdGlvbi0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The desperate search for survivors <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/five-dead-156-still-missing-florida-building-collapse-searchers-race-against-2021-06-27/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continued</a> over the weekend following the partial collapse of the Champlain Towers South condo building in Surfside, FL. Nine people have been confirmed dead and more than 150 remain missing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The latest:<strong style="color:#000"> </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An engineering firm’s </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/engineering-firm-warned-of-systemic-issues-with-miami-area-condo-building-before-deadly-collapse-11624720688?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a></span><span> from 2018 said that faulty waterproofing on the pool deck presented a “systemic issue for this building structure.” It is not clear whether the pool deck was related to the collapse; another 2018 report from the same company gave the building mostly a clean bill of health. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Officials are now considering whether or not to temporarily evacuate the sister building, Champlain Towers North, which is located right next door and was built around the same time.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+</strong> Here are some ways <a href="https://www.wlrn.org/news/2021-06-24/here-are-some-ways-to-help-the-victims-of-the-surfside-condo-collapse?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">you can help</a> the victims and the recovery efforts. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/27/intellia-therapeutics-announces-big-gene-editing-breakthrough-earlyphase-trials?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Gene Editing Breakthrough
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the first time, CRISPR technology has been used to <a href="https://www.bostonglobe.com/2021/06/26/business/results-by-cambridge-based-intellia-regeneron-show-how-crispr-could-transform-treatment/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">successfully treat disease</a> <em>in vivo</em>, or inside the human body. That big medical news was announced Saturday by the biotech startup Intellia Therapeutics and its partner Regeneron, which said their gene-editing techniques reduced the amount of harmful liver protein associated with a genetic nerve disorder. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is CRISPR? </strong>It stands for “clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats,” and it’s one of those things humans found in nature and then copied. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bacteria use CRISPR to repel viruses, but humans have </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ccc4132a-9a4b-4c06-ad2c-a45af3deeb2e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">harnessed it</a></span><span> to ctrl+c, ctrl+v DNA sequences, potentially leading to a revolution in treating disease. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The two scientists who made that breakthrough in 2012, Jennifer Doudna and Emmanuelle Charpentier, won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry last year (Doudna is also a cofounder of Intellia).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote du jour: </strong>“There’s a feeling like we’re walking through a door here into all kinds of new possibilities. And there’s not many moments in medicine where you get to experience that,” Intellia CEO John Leonard said. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect Intellia shares, which have gained 233% since its 2016 IPO, to <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/intellia-therapeutics-interim-phase-1-112530583.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pop</a> today.</p>

<tr>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Not all recessions are created equal. As the stock market boomed last year, US households <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/during-covid-19-most-americans-got-richerespecially-the-rich-11624791602?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added $13.5 trillion</a> in wealth, the biggest annual increase on record. In 2008, households lost $8 trillion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The bad news is that Covid-19 may never go away. The good news is that it is possible to live normally with it in our midst.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Writing in the Straits Times, Singapore’s Covid-19 task force announced plans to treat the coronavirus like <a href="https://www.straitstimes.com/opinion/living-normally-with-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">any other endemic disease</a>, such as the flu. That means scrapping traveler quarantines, daily case number announcements, and intensive contact tracing efforts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The tyranny of spreadsheets. (<a href="https://www.inkl.com/news/the-tyranny-of-spreadsheets?share=pRRQqruAqoX" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Financial Times</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/27/week-ahead-june-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/27/week-ahead-june-28?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="LONDON - JUNE 21:  A 'The Championships' logo is seen at Centre Court du..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTczL3RoZV9jaGFtcGlvbnNoaXBfLV93aW1ibGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ryan Pierse/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>Can we fast-forward to Friday already? The biggest economic event of the week is the release of the June <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/25/the-jobs-report-will-move-markets-in-the-week-ahead-as-stocks-enter-the-second-half-riding-high.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jobs report</a>, which will tell us more about the improving labor market and whether inflation will show up in the form of higher wages. Analysts expect the economy to have added around 700,000 jobs last month, a slight bump from May.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">SCOTUS’s final push: </strong>After a flurry of big rulings, the US Supreme Court will close out its term this week<strong style="color:#000">. </strong>Many Democrats would love to see Justice Stephen Breyer, 82, announce his <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-27/high-court-s-breyer-leaves-democrats-in-suspense-on-retirement?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retirement</a> so that President Biden could nominate a replacement while the Dems have a majority in the Senate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Halftime: </strong>Hit the “reset” button on the year when the second quarter closes Wednesday, June 30.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wimbledon starts today, but without Nadal or Osaka.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Thursday is Canada Day.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sunday is July 4th, and the federal holiday will be celebrated on Monday. Got any fun plans? </span></li>
</ul>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chances are you picked up a few killer recipes during the past year. Well, your kitchen toolkit could use a similar upgrade.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, when you share the Brew using your referral link, you’ll be entered into a raffle to win one of 15 cookware sets from Caraway. A few details to get you excited:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Non-stick ceramic, aluminum core, and stainless steel handles</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coating does not include potentially toxic materials like PFOA, PTFE, other PFAs, lead, cadmium, or toxic metal</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Storage is included</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Remember: </strong>The more people you refer, the more likely you’ll be spending the summer impressing all your friends with your fancy kitchen setup because 1 referral = 1 entry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The raffle lasts just one week, so start racking up your referrals now. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><small>*US winners only. For more rules, see terms and conditions <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23962169.4644/aHR0cDovL21lbWJlcnMubW9ybmluZ2JyZXcuY29tL3Rlcm1zYW5kY29uZGl0aW9ucz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B48c7abd0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.*</small></p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePatrick T. Fallon/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTen more states including Florida, Ohio, and Texas \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/enhanced-unemployment-benefits-end-june-26-10-states/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eended extra unemployment benefits\u003c/a\u003e on Saturday. They join 12 other states that have already opted out this month; all together, 26 states have said “thanks but no thanks” to assistance that’s available until September. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTheir reasoning: Get rid of those Help Wanted signs. Businesses are desperate to hire workers, and many states think scrapping the extra $300/week in unemployment benefits, which the Biden administration incorporated into its pandemic relief bill, will spur more job-seeking. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs it working?  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCould be. In 22 states that canceled enhanced benefits this month, the number of people receiving unemployment benefits is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/americans-are-leaving-unemployment-rolls-more-quickly-in-states-cutting-off-benefits-11624786202?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efalling faster\u003c/a\u003e than in states that have extended the program longer, according to an analysis by Jefferies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the states that cut off the extra payments the earliest, the number of workers who were paid benefits decreased 13.8% from mid-May to mid-June.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat number fell 10% in states cutting benefits in July and 5.7% in states that are waiting it out until September. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther data paints a cloudier picture, though. Earlier this month, the job site Indeed found that job search activity fell \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/JedKolko/status/1402665246456651777?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ebelow\u003c/em\u003e the national trend\u003c/a\u003e in states that cut off extra benefits in June.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eExtra unemployment benefits are dividing people more than pineapple on pizza. Industry groups and Republican lawmakers say that the extra payments disincentivize work and are the leading cause of the worker shortage. 25 out of the 26 states that axed the benefits early are led by GOP governors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome economists and Democrats have said that other factors, such as greater childcare burdens or the fear of contracting Covid, are to blame. On Capitol Hill last week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that extra benefits \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/fed-chair-powell-be-grilled-again-inflation-interest-rates-unemployment-n1271921?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould be playing a role\u003c/a\u003e in the worker shortage problem, but focused his attention on other challenges holding back the job market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003efour more states end enhanced benefits on July 10. Perhaps by then we’ll have more data to understand how the extra $300/week has played a role in the labor market’s sluggish recovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable That big medical news was announced Saturday by the biotech startup Intellia Therapeutics and its partner Regeneron, which said their gene-editing techniques reduced the amount of harmful liver protein associated with a genetic nerve disorder. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is CRISPR? \u003c/strong\u003eIt stands for “clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats,” and it’s one of those things humans found in nature and then copied. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBacteria use CRISPR to repel viruses, but humans have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/ccc4132a-9a4b-4c06-ad2c-a45af3deeb2e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eharnessed it\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to ctrl+c, ctrl+v DNA sequences, potentially leading to a revolution in treating disease. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe two scientists who made that breakthrough in 2012, Jennifer Doudna and Emmanuelle Charpentier, won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry last year (Doudna is also a cofounder of Intellia).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote du jour: \u003c/strong\u003e“There’s a feeling like we’re walking through a door here into all kinds of new possibilities. And there’s not many moments in medicine where you get to experience that,” Intellia CEO John Leonard said. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eexpect Intellia shares, which have gained 233% since its 2016 IPO, to \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/intellia-therapeutics-interim-phase-1-112530583.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" Analysts expect the economy to have added around 700,000 jobs last month, a slight bump from May.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSCOTUS’s final push: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter a flurry of big rulings, the US Supreme Court will close out its term this week\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e. \u003c/strong\u003eMany Democrats would love to see Justice Stephen Breyer, 82, announce his \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-27/high-court-s-breyer-leaves-democrats-in-suspense-on-retirement?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretirement\u003c/a\u003e so that President Biden could nominate a replacement while the Dems have a majority in the Senate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHalftime: \u003c/strong\u003eHit the “reset” button on the year when the second quarter closes Wednesday, June 30.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEverything else:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWimbledon starts today, but without Nadal or Osaka.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThursday is Canada Day.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSunday is July 4th, and the federal holiday will be celebrated on Monday.
